intro: Hieracium ornatiforme, commonly known as the ornate hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers bloom in late summer, producing yellowish to reddish hues, and it is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and seeds. Hieracium ornatiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it can form dense colonies.
